title: I've read that the Soviet Union had problems related to truck manufacturing during WW2, leading to the adoption of mainly US Studebakers but why was that given that they were able to manufacture huge numbers of tanks and other vehicles? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because early in war decision was made to switch most of domestic truck production capacity to armoured vehicles instead of trucks. It was taken after evaluating American and British designs on suitability, cost and maintenance efficiency and value for money. Soviet tanks was simply better buck for money and generally far more suitable for frontline conditions. USSR still produced trucks btw, but much less that usually. In a same period they still made about 250 000 trucks. But that given them capability to build over 130 000 armoured vehicles way above Germany or anyone else.

Substitution. Resources that might have been used to build trucks for military transport were used to build armoured vehicles, or aircraft (aero engines instead of truck engines), etc. Building more tanks does not mean you can build more trucks. Steel, electricity, tools, workers - all these are limited. The 400,000 trucks sent to the USSR (mostly by the USA) during WW2 enabled it to devote more resources to other things.

Russia had a failed economy before the war—things got worse as the war progressed. Manufacturing is a capital-intensive business and Soviet Russia was an anti-capital political establishment. The biggest problem facing the Kremlin 90 years ago was the agriculture-centric economy that existed then. The Soviet state made its initial grab for power by organizing farming. Their programs were so dysfunctional that millions of people starved as a result.

Every country had a finite limit on what it could build and made choices on how to harness that production capability, the Soviets were offered trucks so diverted production capability to producing Armour instead If the Trucks had not been available they would have had to reduce production in some areas and dedicate more resources to truck building
The USSR produced T-60/70 light tanks with truck engines instead and in large numbers. If US trucks were not available for some reason, these would be dropped.
